data.title: Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young – Deja vu – released 11th March 1970. Who’s got this album?
data.meta_description: post suggested by Jim Breeds Gary Kinch… One Two Three Four If I had ever been here before I would probably know just what to do     Don’t you?    Great stuff. Good times. John Wilde… Thanks …
data.text:
post suggested by Jim Breeds

Gary Kinch… One Two Three Four If I had ever been here before I would probably know just what to do Don’t you? Great stuff. Good times.

John Wilde… Thanks for all the wonderful memories boys. Damn we’re old..

David Miller… Love this album – one of the first i ever bought….big influence.

Patrick Lewis… And also 4 Way Street is amazing – great live album of CSNY.

Alan Esdaile… Love Almost Cut My Hair.

John Wilde… Mine too. “Feel like letting my freak flag fly”.

Alan Esdaile… It increases my paranoia, like looking at my mirror and seeing a police car.

Jim Breeds… Yep. Nice gatesleeve affair. Hoping that Graham Nash does the couple of his tracks from this at the DLWP in July

Dennis Torrance… I have some great tracks our house and carry on. The first track I heard was carry on just so good first time I heard it . Last night on sky arts was yes rick wakeman and the concert o2 by led zep . I still love the rock music but like everything now film music as well but not a rap fan

Jo Avery… Yep, classic album!

Andy Qunta…

Steve Reents… I had the cassette.

Patrick Lewis… Yes have this one plus the first one C,S and N and 4 Way Street, probably, one of the best live albums ever.

Pete Prescott… Me !

Colin Fox… Yes, any self respecting musician should have it, also the previous album. We used to do Helpless Hoping in the early 1970s.

Jennie Tocock… Me too!

Tony Davis… Yes I’ve got it. Great album

Paul Morfey… We have all been here before, still got my original album, I brought in the 70ts

Jan Warren… Yep, still got the original album!

Chris Meachen… Somebody stole my vinyl copy years ago, but I’ve since replaced it on cd…. Favourite track for me is 4&20…

Paul Richardson….Sure have Alan, still a favourite. And I agree Patrick Lewis, 4 Way Street remains my favourite live album.

Amanda Brooks… Almost Cut My Hair. It happened just the other day ..
